message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.MA 

This paper deals with the problem of optimizing the performance of a wireless network, specifically Google's Project Loon, by efficiently allocating energy to the balloons. This involves formulating a stochastic optimization problem as a Markov decision process and applying a learning algorithm to obtain optimal policies. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also involves optimization and decision-making, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper deals with information theory and communication, which could place it in cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.MA (Multiagent Systems).
